title: 55 Best Father’s Day Gifts for Every Type of Dad 2025
description: Whether he’s into his wardrobe or more of a gadgets guy
author: Audrey Lee, Will Porter
byline: Audrey Lee, Will Porter, Lizzie Soufleris
excerpt: No matter what he’s into, we’ve got recs for gadgets, games, and more. The best father's day gifts include Amazon tech, Mejuri jewelry, and Away luggage.
text: All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, we may receive compensation from retailers and/or from purchases of products through these links.Heads-up: Father’s Day is June 15, meaning it’s time to show the paternal figures in your life some love. The best Father’s Day gifts should be thoughtful, and to alleviate your stress, we’ve got options, no matter what type of dad he is. From gadgets he’ll actually use to games you can enjoy together, we’ve curated a gift guide that covers just about every base, at every budget. So whether he’s into self-care essentials, is a world-class chef in the kitchen, or is planning a long-awaited getaway, we think there’s something in here that’ll show dad just how much you appreciate him.Our top picks for the best father’s day gifts:For the Style-Forward Dad: Comme des Garçons Embossed Wallet, $100For the Handy Dad: Toyo Y-280 Steel Angle Tool Box, $32For the Dad Who Loves Being Pampered: Flamingo Estate Roma Heirloom Tomato Hand Care Duo, $116For the Dad Who Loves A Beer: Corkcicle Chillsner Portable Beer Chiller, $40For the Dad Who Always Wants A Slice : Ooni Koda 12 Gas Powered Pizza Oven, $399For the Anthology-Loving Dad: New York Times Custom Space History Book, $90Clothing and accessoriesLululemon Steady State Pullover HoodieA classic black sweatshirt is another closet staple he can wear year-round. Luckily, this one from Lululemon won’t fade easily so dad can wear it 100 times over.Cozy Earth Bamboo Stretch-Knit Long Sleeve Pajama SetQuite possibly the nicest, softest pajama set he’ll ever own. Did we mention you can even monogram them?Oliver Peoples Errisson SunglassesThese sunglasses will keep him shaded on morning walks to the office and sunny days sprawled out on the beach. Oliver Peoples are designed to last for a lifetime, meaning these opticals are basically heirlooms in the making.Porter-Yoshida & Co. Noir Tote BagThe hallmark of a great gift is a slightly nicer version of something he already owns. Since he loves his trusty boat n’ tote, give him an upgrade with this Japanese version in a sleek blacked-out look. It’s got six interior pockets to hold everything from his phone to his protein bar and will pair well with any outfit he’s wearing.A.P.C. Black Aly WalletThe slim APC design is made to last, will wear beautifully over time, and keep all of his most important cards and cash in one place without added bulk.Shinola Onyx Tag NeclaceThis pendant necklace is a subtle way to dress up dad’s jeans and T-shirt or add some cool factor to his more formal looks. He can layer it with another thin chain for a minimal stack or make a statement with something chunkier.Mejuri Square Signet RingFor extra brownie points this year, personalize this signet ring with his initials so he can relive his high school glory days. Grab it in his regular size or opt for an on-trend pinky ring moment.Quince Mongolian Cashmere Crewneck SweaterThis luxurious crewneck sweater from Quince Cashmere is the perfect gift for the dad who enjoys the finer things. Plus, it comes in a range of wearable shades, like this steel blue, and a universally flattering burgundy.Patagonia Men's Baggies ShortsHe’s not just a regular dad, he’s a cool dad—so dress him in some Patagonia baggies he’ll live in during the summer or whenever the temperatures call for a little leg.Mejuri Round Box Chain BraceletRound out his jewelry collection with this box chain bracelet that’s subtle enough for even the most normie Apple watch dads to pull off.Tissot PRX Powermatic 80 Bracelet Watch, 40mmFor the kind of dad who appreciates a well-made timepiece, former Hodinkee deputy editor and AD contributor Nora Taylor says this Tissot is “what I recommend for people in my life.”L.L. Bean Men's Wicked Good SlippersSlippers are a quintessential part of any dad’s uniform—so we imagine he’ll love this pair from L.L.Bean that has over 1,700 five-star reviews.Patagonia P-6 Logo Trucker HatA designated dad cap is a great Father’s Day gift for a new dad celebrating his first Father’s Day or a seasoned patriarch. Get him this reliable mesh-back number that’s perfect for long days spent fishing or at the beach.Ray-Ban Meta Headliner Smart GlassesIf he has to have the latest tech he'll appreciate these specs from Ray-Ban and Meta, which can capture pictures and video, play music, and uses AI technology to answer questions.Leather Eyeglass Case HolderThis custom-made leather sunglasses case is a nice way to store dad’s favorite specs. There's even an option to add a monogram so he'll always know it's his.The Ridge WalletAny dad who’s rough on his wallets and card cases will appreciate the durability of this metal one from The Ridge. It’s got RFID shielding to protect your personal information with room for up to 12 cards and a handy outer clip for cash.Leatherology Convertible Tennis ToteFor the dad who can be found lobbing balls on the court, an elevated tennis tote will make him even more excited about his game. This convertible design features handsome leather trim, and you can even personalize it with his initials.Pikore Custom Leather Cable CaseThis organizer is just the thing to keep chargers and cables, or even toiletries, in one place. The leather only gets better with age, just like your old man.Comme des Garçons Embossed WalletDad deserves a wallet that will age just as well as he has. This year pick up a CDG card case that will lend him the savvy of the kind of menswear guy who shops at Dover Street Market.TechCrosley Voyager TurntableEven if he prefers listening to his music on vinyl, this handsome Crosley record player has Bluetooth capabilities to play songs from smartphones or tablets as well.Hyperice Normatec GoFor the dad who is always working out, going on runs, and trying to juggle work with his fitness, get him the Normatec Go air compression sleeves. They use air to massage the legs, helping athletes recover faster and get back to doing what they love most each day.Turtlebox Original Gen 2 SpeakerDads who thrive in the great outdoors will appreciate this ultra-durable Bluetooth speaker that’s known for its superior sound quality and water resistance. Whether he’s ATV-ing with his buddies, out riding waves on his boat, or simply mowing the lawn, he’ll still be able to tune into his favorite songs.Anker 622 Magnetic BatteryFor iPad dads, tech gifts are the way to go. We’d upgrade his current charger to this foldable wireless charging Anker—either in this misty shade of blue or classic black.Apple AirPods MaxIf you’re really looking to splurge this year, a pair of AirPods Max will show you’re not messing around (maybe to go with his Apple watch). Apple’s high fidelity audio﻿, noise cancellation, and up to 20 hours of listening time will allow dad enjoy his favorite music and podcasts anywhere, any time.TUSHY WaveA Tushy bidet is the gift that keeps on giving, offering an easy-to-install setup for the dad who’s useless with a manual and a no-frills interface that gives him some relaxing perks (including a heated water option) without too many extra knobs and levers. Who says trips to the bathroom can’t be a meditative experience?Food and kitchenLibbey Craft Brews Assorted Beer Glasses (Set of 6)The best Father’s Day gift ideas should complement his interests. If dad’s an IPA aficionado, we think he might enjoy his drinks a little more from this handsome set’s assorted pint glasses.Corkcicle Chillsner (Set of 2)For dads who like their beer ice-cold and straight from the bottle, these “Chillsners” will make sure every sip is equally cool and refreshing as the last. Just pop them in the freezer until frozen, put one in your favorite bottle of ale, and enjoy.Ooni Koda 12 Gas Powered Pizza OvenIf you want go above and beyond a gift card to his favorite pizza parlor, aspiring pizzaiolo dads will appreciate this Ooni oven. (Especially since Zoë Sessums concluded that “the ease of use for the Ooni makes it worth it.”)Stanley Classic Easy-Pour GrowlerHead to virtual checkout with this growler from Stanley that can easily do double duty as a water bottle during the day or viking-level beer tumbler for more festive occasions.Crate & Barrel Wood-Handled 9-Piece Barbecue Tool SetAnd if the grill is his sanctuary, he’ll definitely get good use out of this nine-piece barbecue tool set that comes in a convenient carrying case.Maestro Dobel Atelier Animales Endémicos Tequila AñejoThis tequila pulls double duty as both a thoughtful gift for tequila-loving dads and a beautiful art piece he’ll want to make the centerpiece of his bar cart.Sea to Summit Frontier Camping KettleThis kettle is the gift he never knew he needed—especially if he spends his weekends camping. Weighing in at just under half a pound, the efficient, collapsible design means he’ll be able to throw it in his duffle without worrying about added bulk.Chilly's Cutlery SetFor the dad who can appreciate an aggressively practical gift (or just hates disposable plastic), consider a sleek cutlery set that he can tote to work or bring on the road. It’s even slim enough to tuck away in his jacket pocket.Line Color Design Tabletop Wine RackThe man with wine cellar aspirations but a tiny home could use some countertop organization to house his favorite merlots and cabernets of the moment. Present him with a retro silhouette that recalls the years he first started imbibing.Home and hobbiesFlamingo Estate Roma Heirloom Tomato Hand Care DuoThis gift is approved by not one but two members of the AD shopping team. Commerce editor Audrey was “over the moon” to receive this duo as a housewarming gift last year, while writer Julia Harrison said in her testimony, “This has been a godsend for replenishing moisture to my dry hands post-dishwashing.”Parachute Waffle RobeFor the dad who’s into self-care, a spa-quality robe to help him feel just as pampered at home.Bearaby Cotton Napper (15lbs)Since a well-rested dad is the best dad, this comforting weighted blanket should help him catch some shut-eye while also reducing his stress and anxiety.New York Times Custom Space History BookA thoughtful birthday gift and certainly a unique Father’s Day gift, this historical anthology from The New York Times is about all things space. With the option of a bespoke engraving, it’s a lovely personalized gift, especially for the dad who loves his interstellar facts.Anastasio Home 512 Marble TrayDad’s everyday jewelry lineup will find a stylish home in this terra-cotta-colored marble tray from Anastasio Home. He could also use it as a razor holder for his bathroom counter, or even an especially nice catchall tray to hold his keys and wallet.Away The Bigger Carry-OnIf he’s planning a big trip, this sturdy Away luggage is a perfect travel companion—it’s built to handle rough journeys with a water-resistant design and has a handy removable phone charger too.Brouk and Co. Hip Flask SetFor your favorite golfer, a handy hip flask might not help him get on green every time—but will certainly make sure he has more fun.Herzog Leather Watch BoxIf he has an impressive timepiece collection, he’ll appreciate this elegant watch box lined with velvet and ensconced in full grain leather. It’s stylish enough to leave on his dresser or even in high-traffic spaces since it also has a built-in lock.The Underwater World 1. Drawing by Frederic BelaubreShopping with his tastes and interests in mind is never a bad idea. Might we suggest this abstract work for the dad with a MoMA membership.Brooklinen Classic Core Sheet SetHelp dad ditch the navy sheets this holiday with something a little more elevated. Home to some of our favorite bedding and bath towels, Brooklinen offers this sheet set, which comes in playful patterns and interesting colors like basil green and a subtle gray and white stripe.The Container Store Large Drop-Front Shoe Box (Case of 6)If dad’s a sneakerhead, help him to keep his collection organized with this clear shoebox set that’ll allow him to show off his latest rotation.Alchemy Wine Decanter by Ichendorf MilanoFather figures who prefer merlot over pilsners will proudly display this sculptural decanter with a two-tone design from Hawkins.Scotch Porter Beard CollectionOr if he’s rocking a beard, help him keep it in tip-top shape with this set of Scotch Porter beard care essentials—including a wash, conditioner, balm, and serum in a “masculine floral” scent.Vintage National Parks PuzzleStill reminiscing about that camping trip to Arcadia? Both you and Dad can enjoy piecing together this dynamic 1,000-piece National Parks puzzle.Bird Buddy Pro Solar Smart Bird FeederContributor Bailey Berg told us the Bird Buddy Smart Bird Feeder “is like a doorbell cam for your backyard birds—but way cuter.” And if dad’s an avid bird watcher, he’ll delight int identifying different feathered visitors from the high-res portraits the smart feeder captures. The device also uses AI to ID them at lightning speed, meaning he’ll also get real-time notifications of birds, including push alerts for frequent fliers (which he’ll be able to give nicknames to within the app—aw).Toyo Y-280 Steel Angle Tool BoxIf he’s the handiest guy you know, he’ll definitely appreciate this lightweight case that can house his tools and smaller power tools. Made in Japan from durable stainless steel, this minimalist design will add a touch of modern elegance to any workbench.DS & Durga Cowboy Grass PerfumeFather’s Day is a great opportunity to introduce a new scent into his rotation. D.S. & Durga’s Cowboy Grass fuses herbaceous notes of sage and thyme with prairie grass and vetiver for the dad who embodies yeehaw energy.Papier Bear Writing Paper SetThe dad who prefers real Father’s Day cards and handwritten letters rather than an emails or texts will definitely enjoy this customized stationery set featuring a charming bear illustration.Grovemade Desk PenLast, but not least on our list of Father's Day gifts, not many things in life are as satisfying as a pen that neatly glides across the page. Made from precision-machined aluminum, the one-piece pen is designed to last a lifetime. The triangle grip is unique, yet comfortable, and the premium rollerball ink cartridges roll smooth every time."Anime Architecture" by Stefan RiekelesSince the two of you love binging the latest animes, this stylish coffee table book is an especially thoughtful gift. He’ll be able to flip through pages that detail the world-building process behind acclaimed animations like Akira, Ghost in the Shell, Metropolis, and beyond.Kikkerland Crab Compact EDC Multi ToolFor the handiest of father figures, here’s a charming multitool shaped like a crab. Complete with miniature scissors, a flathead screwdriver, and even a bottle opener, this tool is an adorably beachy alternative to traditional pocketknives.
html:
All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, we may receive compensation from retailers and/or from purchases of products through these links.

Heads-up: Father’s Day is June 15, meaning it’s time to show the paternal figures in your life some love. The best Father’s Day gifts should be thoughtful, and to alleviate your stress, we’ve got options, no matter what type of dad he is. From gadgets he’ll actually use to games you can enjoy together, we’ve curated a gift guide that covers just about every base, at every budget. So whether he’s into self-care essentials, is a world-class chef in the kitchen, or is planning a long-awaited getaway, we think there’s something in here that’ll show dad just how much you appreciate him.

Our top picks for the best father’s day gifts:

  • For the Style-Forward Dad: Comme des Garçons Embossed Wallet, $100
  • For the Handy Dad: Toyo Y-280 Steel Angle Tool Box, $32
  • For the Dad Who Loves Being Pampered: Flamingo Estate Roma Heirloom Tomato Hand Care Duo, $116
  • For the Dad Who Loves A Beer: Corkcicle Chillsner Portable Beer Chiller, $40
  • For the Dad Who Always Wants A Slice : Ooni Koda 12 Gas Powered Pizza Oven, $399
  • For the Anthology-Loving Dad: New York Times Custom Space History Book, $90

Clothing and accessories

Lululemon Steady State Pullover Hoodie

A classic black sweatshirt is another closet staple he can wear year-round. Luckily, this one from Lululemon won’t fade easily so dad can wear it 100 times over.

Cozy Earth Bamboo Stretch-Knit Long Sleeve Pajama Set

Quite possibly the nicest, softest pajama set he’ll ever own. Did we mention you can even monogram them?

Oliver Peoples Errisson Sunglasses

These sunglasses will keep him shaded on morning walks to the office and sunny days sprawled out on the beach. Oliver Peoples are designed to last for a lifetime, meaning these opticals are basically heirlooms in the making.

Porter-Yoshida & Co. Noir Tote Bag

The hallmark of a great gift is a slightly nicer version of something he already owns. Since he loves his trusty boat n’ tote, give him an upgrade with this Japanese version in a sleek blacked-out look. It’s got six interior pockets to hold everything from his phone to his protein bar and will pair well with any outfit he’s wearing.

A.P.C. Black Aly Wallet

The slim APC design is made to last, will wear beautifully over time, and keep all of his most important cards and cash in one place without added bulk.

Shinola Onyx Tag Neclace

This pendant necklace is a subtle way to dress up dad’s jeans and T-shirt or add some cool factor to his more formal looks. He can layer it with another thin chain for a minimal stack or make a statement with something chunkier.

Mejuri Square Signet Ring

For extra brownie points this year, personalize this signet ring with his initials so he can relive his high school glory days. Grab it in his regular size or opt for an on-trend pinky ring moment.

Quince Mongolian Cashmere Crewneck Sweater

This luxurious crewneck sweater from Quince Cashmere is the perfect gift for the dad who enjoys the finer things. Plus, it comes in a range of wearable shades, like this steel blue, and a universally flattering burgundy.

Patagonia Men's Baggies Shorts

He’s not just a regular dad, he’s a cool dad—so dress him in some Patagonia baggies he’ll live in during the summer or whenever the temperatures call for a little leg.

Mejuri Round Box Chain Bracelet

Round out his jewelry collection with this box chain bracelet that’s subtle enough for even the most normie Apple watch dads to pull off.

Tissot PRX Powermatic 80 Bracelet Watch, 40mm

For the kind of dad who appreciates a well-made timepiece, former Hodinkee deputy editor and AD contributor Nora Taylor says this Tissot is “what I recommend for people in my life.”

L.L. Bean Men's Wicked Good Slippers

Slippers are a quintessential part of any dad’s uniform—so we imagine he’ll love this pair from L.L.Bean that has over 1,700 five-star reviews.

Patagonia P-6 Logo Trucker Hat

A designated dad cap is a great Father’s Day gift for a new dad celebrating his first Father’s Day or a seasoned patriarch. Get him this reliable mesh-back number that’s perfect for long days spent fishing or at the beach.

Ray-Ban Meta Headliner Smart Glasses

If he has to have the latest tech he'll appreciate these specs from Ray-Ban and Meta, which can capture pictures and video, play music, and uses AI technology to answer questions.

Leather Eyeglass Case Holder

This custom-made leather sunglasses case is a nice way to store dad’s favorite specs. There's even an option to add a monogram so he'll always know it's his.

The Ridge Wallet

Any dad who’s rough on his wallets and card cases will appreciate the durability of this metal one from The Ridge. It’s got RFID shielding to protect your personal information with room for up to 12 cards and a handy outer clip for cash.

Leatherology Convertible Tennis Tote

For the dad who can be found lobbing balls on the court, an elevated tennis tote will make him even more excited about his game. This convertible design features handsome leather trim, and you can even personalize it with his initials.

Pikore Custom Leather Cable Case

This organizer is just the thing to keep chargers and cables, or even toiletries, in one place. The leather only gets better with age, just like your old man.

Comme des Garçons Embossed Wallet

Dad deserves a wallet that will age just as well as he has. This year pick up a CDG card case that will lend him the savvy of the kind of menswear guy who shops at Dover Street Market.

Tech

Crosley Voyager Turntable

Even if he prefers listening to his music on vinyl, this handsome Crosley record player has Bluetooth capabilities to play songs from smartphones or tablets as well.

Hyperice Normatec Go

For the dad who is always working out, going on runs, and trying to juggle work with his fitness, get him the Normatec Go air compression sleeves. They use air to massage the legs, helping athletes recover faster and get back to doing what they love most each day.

Turtlebox Original Gen 2 Speaker

Dads who thrive in the great outdoors will appreciate this ultra-durable Bluetooth speaker that’s known for its superior sound quality and water resistance. Whether he’s ATV-ing with his buddies, out riding waves on his boat, or simply mowing the lawn, he’ll still be able to tune into his favorite songs.

Anker 622 Magnetic Battery

For iPad dads, tech gifts are the way to go. We’d upgrade his current charger to this foldable wireless charging Anker—either in this misty shade of blue or classic black.

Apple AirPods Max

If you’re really looking to splurge this year, a pair of AirPods Max will show you’re not messing around (maybe to go with his Apple watch). Apple’s high fidelity audio﻿, noise cancellation, and up to 20 hours of listening time will allow dad enjoy his favorite music and podcasts anywhere, any time.

TUSHY Wave

A Tushy bidet is the gift that keeps on giving, offering an easy-to-install setup for the dad who’s useless with a manual and a no-frills interface that gives him some relaxing perks (including a heated water option) without too many extra knobs and levers. Who says trips to the bathroom can’t be a meditative experience?

Food and kitchen

Libbey Craft Brews Assorted Beer Glasses (Set of 6)

The best Father’s Day gift ideas should complement his interests. If dad’s an IPA aficionado, we think he might enjoy his drinks a little more from this handsome set’s assorted pint glasses.

Corkcicle Chillsner (Set of 2)

For dads who like their beer ice-cold and straight from the bottle, these “Chillsners” will make sure every sip is equally cool and refreshing as the last. Just pop them in the freezer until frozen, put one in your favorite bottle of ale, and enjoy.

Ooni Koda 12 Gas Powered Pizza Oven

If you want go above and beyond a gift card to his favorite pizza parlor, aspiring pizzaiolo dads will appreciate this Ooni oven. (Especially since Zoë Sessums concluded that “the ease of use for the Ooni makes it worth it.”)

Stanley Classic Easy-Pour Growler

Head to virtual checkout with this growler from Stanley that can easily do double duty as a water bottle during the day or viking-level beer tumbler for more festive occasions.

Crate & Barrel Wood-Handled 9-Piece Barbecue Tool Set

And if the grill is his sanctuary, he’ll definitely get good use out of this nine-piece barbecue tool set that comes in a convenient carrying case.

Maestro Dobel Atelier Animales Endémicos Tequila Añejo

This tequila pulls double duty as both a thoughtful gift for tequila-loving dads and a beautiful art piece he’ll want to make the centerpiece of his bar cart.

Sea to Summit Frontier Camping Kettle

This kettle is the gift he never knew he needed—especially if he spends his weekends camping. Weighing in at just under half a pound, the efficient, collapsible design means he’ll be able to throw it in his duffle without worrying about added bulk.

Chilly's Cutlery Set

For the dad who can appreciate an aggressively practical gift (or just hates disposable plastic), consider a sleek cutlery set that he can tote to work or bring on the road. It’s even slim enough to tuck away in his jacket pocket.

Line Color Design Tabletop Wine Rack

The man with wine cellar aspirations but a tiny home could use some countertop organization to house his favorite merlots and cabernets of the moment. Present him with a retro silhouette that recalls the years he first started imbibing.

Home and hobbies

Flamingo Estate Roma Heirloom Tomato Hand Care Duo

This gift is approved by not one but two members of the AD shopping team. Commerce editor Audrey was “over the moon” to receive this duo as a housewarming gift last year, while writer Julia Harrison said in her testimony, “This has been a godsend for replenishing moisture to my dry hands post-dishwashing.”

Parachute Waffle Robe

For the dad who’s into self-care, a spa-quality robe to help him feel just as pampered at home.

Bearaby Cotton Napper (15lbs)

Since a well-rested dad is the best dad, this comforting weighted blanket should help him catch some shut-eye while also reducing his stress and anxiety.

New York Times Custom Space History Book

A thoughtful birthday gift and certainly a unique Father’s Day gift, this historical anthology from The New York Times is about all things space. With the option of a bespoke engraving, it’s a lovely personalized gift, especially for the dad who loves his interstellar facts.

Anastasio Home 512 Marble Tray

Dad’s everyday jewelry lineup will find a stylish home in this terra-cotta-colored marble tray from Anastasio Home. He could also use it as a razor holder for his bathroom counter, or even an especially nice catchall tray to hold his keys and wallet.

Away The Bigger Carry-On

If he’s planning a big trip, this sturdy Away luggage is a perfect travel companion—it’s built to handle rough journeys with a water-resistant design and has a handy removable phone charger too.

Brouk and Co. Hip Flask Set

For your favorite golfer, a handy hip flask might not help him get on green every time—but will certainly make sure he has more fun.

Herzog Leather Watch Box

If he has an impressive timepiece collection, he’ll appreciate this elegant watch box lined with velvet and ensconced in full grain leather. It’s stylish enough to leave on his dresser or even in high-traffic spaces since it also has a built-in lock.

The Underwater World 1. Drawing by Frederic Belaubre

Shopping with his tastes and interests in mind is never a bad idea. Might we suggest this abstract work for the dad with a MoMA membership.

Brooklinen Classic Core Sheet Set

Help dad ditch the navy sheets this holiday with something a little more elevated. Home to some of our favorite bedding and bath towels, Brooklinen offers this sheet set, which comes in playful patterns and interesting colors like basil green and a subtle gray and white stripe.

The Container Store Large Drop-Front Shoe Box (Case of 6)

If dad’s a sneakerhead, help him to keep his collection organized with this clear shoebox set that’ll allow him to show off his latest rotation.

Alchemy Wine Decanter by Ichendorf Milano

Father figures who prefer merlot over pilsners will proudly display this sculptural decanter with a two-tone design from Hawkins.

Scotch Porter Beard Collection

Or if he’s rocking a beard, help him keep it in tip-top shape with this set of Scotch Porter beard care essentials—including a wash, conditioner, balm, and serum in a “masculine floral” scent.

Vintage National Parks Puzzle

Still reminiscing about that camping trip to Arcadia? Both you and Dad can enjoy piecing together this dynamic 1,000-piece National Parks puzzle.

Bird Buddy Pro Solar Smart Bird Feeder

Contributor Bailey Berg told us the Bird Buddy Smart Bird Feeder “is like a doorbell cam for your backyard birds—but way cuter.” And if dad’s an avid bird watcher, he’ll delight int identifying different feathered visitors from the high-res portraits the smart feeder captures. The device also uses AI to ID them at lightning speed, meaning he’ll also get real-time notifications of birds, including push alerts for frequent fliers (which he’ll be able to give nicknames to within the app—aw).

Toyo Y-280 Steel Angle Tool Box

If he’s the handiest guy you know, he’ll definitely appreciate this lightweight case that can house his tools and smaller power tools. Made in Japan from durable stainless steel, this minimalist design will add a touch of modern elegance to any workbench.

DS & Durga Cowboy Grass Perfume

Father’s Day is a great opportunity to introduce a new scent into his rotation. D.S. & Durga’s Cowboy Grass fuses herbaceous notes of sage and thyme with prairie grass and vetiver for the dad who embodies yeehaw energy.

Papier Bear Writing Paper Set

The dad who prefers real Father’s Day cards and handwritten letters rather than an emails or texts will definitely enjoy this customized stationery set featuring a charming bear illustration.

Grovemade Desk Pen

Last, but not least on our list of Father's Day gifts, not many things in life are as satisfying as a pen that neatly glides across the page. Made from precision-machined aluminum, the one-piece pen is designed to last a lifetime. The triangle grip is unique, yet comfortable, and the premium rollerball ink cartridges roll smooth every time.

"Anime Architecture" by Stefan Riekeles

Since the two of you love binging the latest animes, this stylish coffee table book is an especially thoughtful gift. He’ll be able to flip through pages that detail the world-building process behind acclaimed animations like Akira, Ghost in the Shell, Metropolis, and beyond.

Kikkerland Crab Compact EDC Multi Tool

For the handiest of father figures, here’s a charming multitool shaped like a crab. Complete with miniature scissors, a flathead screwdriver, and even a bottle opener, this tool is an adorably beachy alternative to traditional pocketknives.
